p: Targeting antioxidants, AGEs, and AR as potential therapeutic approaches for the prevention and amelioration of diabetic complications have attracted growing interest [ 1, 2, 3], whereas natural products play an important role [ 9, 10]. In this study, the anti-diabetic potential of the 70% methanol extract of M. volcanica was evaluated via its capacities of antioxidant, antiglycation, and AR inhibition.
